ARABIC: إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ مُتَبَّرٌ مَّا هُمْ فِيهِ وَبَٰطِلٌ مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: What these people are doing is destined for destruction. What they are doing is purposeless.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: These people and their ways will surely be destroyed, for false is what they practise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: The way these people follow is bound to lead to destruction; and all their works are vain.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: What these people worship is doomed to be destroyed and their deeds are based on falsehood.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “The condition they are in is, in fact, one of destruction – and all what they do is utter falsehood.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: [Musa added:] "Verily, these people will be destroyed for that which they are engaged in (idols' worship). And all that they are doing is in vain."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: (As to) these, surely that about which they are shall be brought to naught and that which they do is vain.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Surely this they are engaged upon shall be shattered, and void is what they have been doing.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! as for these, their way will be destroyed and all that they are doing is in vain.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: what they are engaged in is doomed to destruction and all their works are in vain."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily these! destroyed is that wherein they are engaged and vain is that which they have been doing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: What they are engaged in is indeed bound to perish, and what they have been doing shall come to naught.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: As to these folk,- the cult they are in is (but) a fragment of a ruin, and vain is the (worship) which they practise."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: [Musa (Moses) added:] "Verily, these people will be destroyed for that which they are engaged in (idols-worship). And all that they are doing is in vain."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: That which they are engaged upon shall be shattered and all their works are vain.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: “What these people are concerned with is perdition, and their deeds are based on falsehoods.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, those [worshippers] - destroyed is that in which they are [engaged], and worthless is whatever they were doing."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [7:139] Truly as for these, their way will be destroyed and what they have been doing is in vain’.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! as for these, their way) their idolatry (will be destroyed and all that they are doing) of idolatry (is in vain) is error.
